article.headline: Manhattan 73, Siena 72
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Antoine Pearson scored 20 points, hitting six 3-pointers, and Manhattan held off Siena 73-72 Monday night. Chris Smith added 13 points and 12 rebounds, and Devon Austin had 12 points for the Jaspers (11-15, 5-11), who have won three straight. Edwin Ubiles scored 24 points and Alex Franklin had 17 points and 13 rebounds for the Saints (16-10, 11-5). Kenny Hasbrouck had a chance to give Siena the victory, but his running one-hander from 12 feet bounced off the rim at the buzzer. Darryl Crawford had six of his eight points in the first half to help Manhattan to a 28-27 lead at the break. Tay Fisher?s 3-point basket with 12:37 left in the game gave the Saints a 47-44 lead. Pearson's 3-pointer with 4:03 remaining put the Jaspers ahead to stay at 66-64. Moore scored with 44 seconds left to cut the edge to 73-72. Siena got the ball back on a rebound with 2.2 seconds to go and called timeout, preceding Hasbrouck's final try. Moore and Fisher scored 12 points apiece for the Saints.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
